arts.ttl: Joao Pedro's LATE penalty sends Brighton up to sixth
arts.sum: Joao Pedro’s late, late penalty earned Brighton & Hove Albion a fourth straight Premier League win and their first over Fulham in the competition, sending the Seagulls up to sixth in the race for Europe. Kaoru Mitoma and Simon Adingra both had second-half goals disallowed for offside, and it looked like Brighton’s search for a winner would be in vain, but Joao Pedro ’s spot-kick in the eighth minute of stoppage time earned a crucial three points.

arts.ttl: Nottingham Forest secure crucial win as Brighton snatch dramatic Premier League victory
arts.sum: Elsewhere, Ollie Watkins scored against his former club as Aston Villa beat Brentford, and Crystal Palace continued their good form

arts.ttl: 'Tony always says' - Fabian Hurzeler echoes Brighton's owner's scepticism after in-form Seagulls beat Fulham
arts.sum: Brighton manager Fabian Hurzeler would not be drawn in on chat surrounding a push for Europe, after a dramatic late win over Fulham saw the team extend its winning run to six games in all competitions.

arts.ttl: It’s clearly our fault that we lost – Marco Silva on Fulham’s defeat at Brighton
arts.sum: Joao Pedro scored a stoppage-time penalty as the Seagulls finally beat Fulham in the Premier League at the 10th attempt.

arts.ttl: Brighton only team who wanted to win - Hurzeler
arts.sum: Brighton head coach Fabian Hurzeler says they were the 'only team on the pitch who wanted to win' following their last-gasp 2-1 victory over Fulham in the Premier League.

arts.ttl: Brighton player ratings vs Fulham as one 9 and one 5 awarded in chase for Europe
arts.sum: How the Seagulls rated in their 2-1 win against Fulham at the Amex Stadium

arts.ttl: Joao Pedro scores late penalty as Brighton finally beat Fulham in Premier League
arts.sum: Albion looked set to be frustrated by the Cottagers once again, having never beaten them in nine previous attempts.

arts.ttl: Liverpool, Man United 'learn asking price' for Fulham's assist king ahead of summer transfer window
arts.sum: Liverpool and Manchester United allegedly learn that only offers in excess of £40m would be considered by Fulham for Antonee Robinson.

arts.ttl: Brighton team news vs Fulham: Key star passes fitness test but youngster is a surprise absentee as seven players miss out
arts.sum: Kaoru Mitoma is fit enough to start for Brighton but they are without seven players for the visit of Fulham in the Premier League.

arts.ttl: Liverpool v Southampton, Brighton v Fulham, and more: football – live
arts.sum: All the latest updates from the Saturday afternoon action Live scores | Premier League top scorers | Email Dominic The report via Peter Lansley has dropped from the City Ground. As he rightly writes: “Manchester City continued their plummet from Premier League champions to scrambling to qualify for the Champions League, but the achievements of [Nottingham Forest] deserve full recognition”.
